title: Gyoza Sauce Recipe
description: This gyoza sauce recipe uses basic pantry ingredients to make a simple, slightly spicy Japanese dipping sauce for dumplings or fried spring rolls.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Gyoza Sauce 4.5 (158) 120 Reviews 17 Photos Gyoza sauce is a slightly-spicy Japanese dipping sauce for potstickers or spring rolls. Submitted by Rebecca Friedman Updated on November 7, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 1 1/2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Brenda Giles-Karagiannis Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings ½ cup rice vinegar ½ cup low-sodium soy sauce ⅓ cup thinly sliced green onions 1 garlic clove, minced 1 teaspoon sesame oil ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes ½ teaspoon minced fresh ginger root Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk together rice vinegar, soy sauce, green onions, garlic, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, and ginger in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Let sit for 15 minutes before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 253 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 8 Calories 0g Fat 1g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 8 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 266mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 1g 0% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 0g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 3mg 0% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 23mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Gyoza Sauce 01 of 17 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 17 Photo by  JumpyWok4544 07/09/2024 Great flavors I agree with Marie Myers, we like our Gyoza sauce with a little sweet and heat. I also used brown sugar and left out the garlic. On a side note, I did use the other ingredients but my measurements were dashes and pinches to taste. I didn't have rice vinegar handy, so I have found a small dash of apple cider vinegar is a decent substitute. Heating the mixture in a pyrex measuring cup for 1 minute in the microwave helps to meld all the flavors and evenly mix the brown sugar. My wife and I thought it was delicious and we'll use this recipe to make our variation again. 03 of 17 Photo by  Stephanie Rybicki 01/18/2021 04 of 17 Photo by  Mallory 06/16/2020 05 of 17 Photo by  J Alan Hall 05/11/2020 Made as written, it was excellent. Will make this again, and again. 06 of 17 Photo by  Pat J 05/07/2020 07 of 17 Photo by  Megan Ritchie 04/27/2020 08 of 17 Photo by  Craig Musch 02/19/2020 I added a little more ginger, soy sauce and scallions. 09 of 17 Photo by  Brenda Giles-Karagiannis 05/31/2019 10 of 17 Photo by  Reina Dunkin 02/08/2019 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Spicy Stir-Fry Sauce 27 Ratings Hot and Sweet Sesame Dressing 8 Ratings Teriyaki Marinade and Sauce 138 Ratings Teriyaki Sauce and Marinade 311 Ratings Todd's Famous Thai Peanut Sauce 15 Ratings Chimichurri Marinade 2 Ratings How to Make Peanut Dipping Sauce 56 Ratings Easy Chimichurri Sauce 2 Ratings Chinese-Style Sesame Sauce 157 Ratings Cucumber Salad With Thai Sweet Chili Vinaigrette 89 Ratings Chimichurri Muy Pefecto 14 Ratings Japanese Dressing 2 Ratings Cilantro-Chili Pepper Sauce 9 Ratings Asian Dipping Sauce 17 Ratings The Best Thai Curry-Peanut Sauce 67 Ratings Gochujang Sauce 13 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
